texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Mission & value proposition
texts.text: Mission & value proposition

texts.label: text
texts.orig: A Data Scientist turns raw data into reliable decisions, products, and measurable business impact. The mission is to reduce uncertainty with evidence, build models that generalize, and create feedback loops so the organization learns faster than competitors.
texts.text: A Data Scientist turns raw data into reliable decisions, products, and measurable business impact. The mission is to reduce uncertainty with evidence, build models that generalize, and create feedback loops so the organization learns faster than competitors.

texts.label: list_item

texts.text: Turn data into decisions: hypotheses  experiments/models  actions  measured impact

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Increase revenue/retention and reduce cost/risk via better targeting, automation, and forecasting
texts.text: Increase revenue/retention and reduce cost/risk via better targeting, automation, and forecasting

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Shorten decision cycles with reproducible analyses, dashboards, and self-serve tools
texts.text: Shorten decision cycles with reproducible analyses, dashboards, and self-serve tools

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Build durable assets: high-quality datasets, features, models, and documentation

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Institutionalize learning: A/B tests, post-mortems, model monitoring, knowledge bases

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: NLP (classification, NER, RAG, LLM apps)
texts.text: NLP (classification, NER, RAG, LLM apps)

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Natural Language Processing turns unstructured text into structured signals and decisions. Modern NLP blends classic supervised tasks (classification/NER) with retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) and LLM-powered apps. What you do (in depth): Build datasets from logs/docs/chats, define label taxonomies, choose model families (linear  transformers), evaluate with task-appropriate metrics, and ship APIs or in-product features with monitoring for drift, toxicity, and hallucinations.
texts.text: Natural Language Processing turns unstructured text into structured signals and decisions. Modern NLP blends classic supervised tasks (classification/NER) with retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) and LLM-powered apps. What you do (in depth): Build datasets from logs/docs/chats, define label taxonomies, choose model families (linear  transformers), evaluate with task-appropriate metrics, and ship APIs or in-product features with monitoring for drift, toxicity, and hallucinations.

texts.orig: CV converts pixels into objects, masks, and text-used in quality control, document processing, safety, and AR. What you do (in depth): Collect labeled images/video, manage class imbalance, pick task-specific models (detection vs segmentation vs OCR), and deploy on cloud or edge with careful latency/throughput trade-offs.
texts.text: CV converts pixels into objects, masks, and text-used in quality control, document processing, safety, and AR. What you do (in depth): Collect labeled images/video, manage class imbalance, pick task-specific models (detection vs segmentation vs OCR), and deploy on cloud or edge with careful latency/throughput trade-offs.

texts.text: Recommender Systems (ranking, retrieval, bandits)

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Recsys matches users to items (content, products, ads). It's a two-tower world: fast retrieval then precise ranking, with exploration to avoid stagnation.
texts.text: Recsys matches users to items (content, products, ads). It's a two-tower world: fast retrieval then precise ranking, with exploration to avoid stagnation.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: What you do (in depth): Design objectives (engagement vs revenue vs diversity), build features
texts.text: What you do (in depth): Design objectives (engagement vs revenue vs diversity), build features

texts.label: text
texts.orig: (user/item/context), architect retrieval + ranking stacks, and validate online with A/B tests and guardrails.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Causal Inference & Experimentation (A/B, CUPED, uplift)
texts.text: Causal Inference & Experimentation (A/B, CUPED, uplift)

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Causal DS asks 'what caused what?' not just 'what correlates.' It powers confident decision-making and trustworthy KPI movement.
texts.text: Causal DS asks 'what caused what?' not just 'what correlates.' It powers confident decision-making and trustworthy KPI movement.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: What you do (in depth): Design experiments, compute power/MDE, run clean randomization, analyze effects with variance reduction (CUPED), and where RCTs aren't possible, use observational methods with sensitivity checks.

texts.orig: 3) Core Competencies - Data Scientist
texts.text: 3) Core Competencies - Data Scientist

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Math & Stats (probability, inference, causality basics)
texts.text: Math & Stats (probability, inference, causality basics)

texts.label: text
texts.orig: A data scientist's rigor comes from statistical thinking: modeling uncertainty, identifying signal vs noise, and making defensible claims about cause and effect. You should be able to choose appropriate assumptions, quantify uncertainty, and explain trade-offs (bias/variance, power, sample size).
texts.text: A data scientist's rigor comes from statistical thinking: modeling uncertainty, identifying signal vs noise, and making defensible claims about cause and effect. You should be able to choose appropriate assumptions, quantify uncertainty, and explain trade-offs (bias/variance, power, sample size).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Probability & distributions: conditional probability, Bayes rule; common families (Bernoulli/Binomial, Poisson, Gaussian, Log-normal); when heavy tails matter.
texts.text: Probability & distributions: conditional probability, Bayes rule; common families (Bernoulli/Binomial, Poisson, Gaussian, Log-normal); when heavy tails matter.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Estimation: MLE/MAP, bias-variance trade-off, bootstrapping/jackknife for CIs, calibration of predicted probabilities.
texts.text: Estimation: MLE/MAP, bias-variance trade-off, bootstrapping/jackknife for CIs, calibration of predicted probabilities.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Hypothesis testing: null/alt, p-values, power/MDE, multiple testing control (BH/FDR), non-parametric tests (MWU/KS).
texts.text: Hypothesis testing: null/alt, p-values, power/MDE, multiple testing control (BH/FDR), non-parametric tests (MWU/KS).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Uncertainty: confidence vs prediction intervals; propagation of error; robust stats (medians, Huber loss).
texts.text: Uncertainty: confidence vs prediction intervals; propagation of error; robust stats (medians, Huber loss).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Causality basics: potential outcomes, ATE/ATE by cohort (HTE), confounding, DAGs/back-door, randomization as gold standard.
texts.text: Causality basics: potential outcomes, ATE/ATE by cohort (HTE), confounding, DAGs/back-door, randomization as gold standard.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Observational methods: matching/weighting, propensity scores, DiD, IVs; sensitivity analysis to hidden bias.
texts.text: Observational methods: matching/weighting, propensity scores, DiD, IVs; sensitivity analysis to hidden bias.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Common pitfalls: p-hacking/metric shopping, Simpson's paradox, leakage, non-IID data (clusters, time dependence).
texts.text: Common pitfalls: p-hacking/metric shopping, Simpson's paradox, leakage, non-IID data (clusters, time dependence).

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Production-oriented coding turns notebooks into reliable assets. Aim for readable, testable, reproducible code with clear environments and CI.
texts.text: Production-oriented coding turns notebooks into reliable assets. Aim for readable, testable, reproducible code with clear environments and CI.

texts.label: list_item

texts.text: Environments & packaging: pyproject.toml/Poetry or pip + requirements; pinned versions; reproducible seeds.

texts.text: Structure: notebook  module pattern; CLI scripts; config via .env/YAML; logging (logging), typing (typing, pydantic).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Testing: unit tests for feature functions and metrics (pytest); data contract tests (Great Expectations); property-based tests (hypothesis).
texts.text: Testing: unit tests for feature functions and metrics (pytest); data contract tests (Great Expectations); property-based tests (hypothesis).

texts.label: list_item

texts.text: Reproducibility: seeds, data snapshots, deterministic ops; model/feature registries (MLflow).

texts.label: list_item

texts.text: Performance: vectorization (NumPy/Pandas), profiling (cProfile, line_profiler), parallelism (joblib), JIT (Numba) when needed.

texts.label: list_item

texts.text: Quality: lint/format (ruff/black), pre-commit hooks, small pure functions, docstrings.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Anti-patterns: hidden state in notebooks, mixing EDA & training code paths, unpinned deps.
texts.text: Anti-patterns: hidden state in notebooks, mixing EDA & training code paths, unpinned deps.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: SQL & Data Wrangling (joins, window funcs, performance)
texts.text: SQL & Data Wrangling (joins, window funcs, performance)

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Strong SQL prevents subtle errors and slow dashboards. You should write correct, explainable queries that scale and respect data contracts.
texts.text: Strong SQL prevents subtle errors and slow dashboards. You should write correct, explainable queries that scale and respect data contracts.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Joins: inner/left/right/full; null semantics; de-duplication with surrogate keys; many-to-many explode hazards.
texts.text: Joins: inner/left/right/full; null semantics; de-duplication with surrogate keys; many-to-many explode hazards.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Window functions: ROW_NUMBER, LAG/LEAD, cumulative sums, sessionization; partitioning by entity and ordering by time.
texts.text: Window functions: ROW_NUMBER, LAG/LEAD, cumulative sums, sessionization; partitioning by entity and ordering by time.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Time & grains: defining canonical event time, late-arriving data, slowly changing dimensions (SCD), timezone consistency.
texts.text: Time & grains: defining canonical event time, late-arriving data, slowly changing dimensions (SCD), timezone consistency.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Performance: predicate pushdown, clustering/partitioning, avoiding SELECT *, approximate functions for big scans.
texts.text: Performance: predicate pushdown, clustering/partitioning, avoiding SELECT *, approximate functions for big scans.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Reliability: CTEs for readability; idempotent incremental loads (MERGE/UPSERT); data quality checks (row counts, uniqueness, referential integrity).
texts.text: Reliability: CTEs for readability; idempotent incremental loads (MERGE/UPSERT); data quality checks (row counts, uniqueness, referential integrity).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Wrangling: tidy data shapes, wide  long pivots, categorical encoding, missing-data strategies.
texts.text: Wrangling: tidy data shapes, wide  long pivots, categorical encoding, missing-data strategies.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Anti-patterns: windowing without partitions, cartesian joins, computing KPIs at mixed grains.
texts.text: Anti-patterns: windowing without partitions, cartesian joins, computing KPIs at mixed grains.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Visualization & Storytelling (clear narratives, visuals)
texts.text: Visualization & Storytelling (clear narratives, visuals)

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Visuals are for decisions, not decoration. Great storytelling frames the question, shows comparisons, and annotates the 'so what'.
texts.text: Visuals are for decisions, not decoration. Great storytelling frames the question, shows comparisons, and annotates the 'so what'.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Narrative arc: question  method (brief)  result  implication/recommendation  risk/next step.
texts.text: Narrative arc: question  method (brief)  result  implication/recommendation  risk/next step.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Chart choices:
texts.text: Chart choices:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Distribution (hist/box/violin), comparison (bar/line), relationship (scatter), part-of-whole (stacked bars), uncertainty (error bands/intervals).
texts.text: o Distribution (hist/box/violin), comparison (bar/line), relationship (scatter), part-of-whole (stacked bars), uncertainty (error bands/intervals).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Principles: preattentive cues (position first), declutter (zero baselines where needed), consistent scales/colors, highlight deltas.
texts.text: Principles: preattentive cues (position first), declutter (zero baselines where needed), consistent scales/colors, highlight deltas.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Uncertainty: CIs, prediction intervals, fan charts, sample sizes; avoid hiding variance.
texts.text: Uncertainty: CIs, prediction intervals, fan charts, sample sizes; avoid hiding variance.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Dashboards vs memos: operational monitoring (freshness & guardrails) vs one-time decision docs (annotated insights).
texts.text: Dashboards vs memos: operational monitoring (freshness & guardrails) vs one-time decision docs (annotated insights).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Accessibility: colorblind-safe palettes, readable labels, mobile-first layouts when needed.
texts.text: Accessibility: colorblind-safe palettes, readable labels, mobile-first layouts when needed.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Anti-patterns: dual y-axes misuse, 3D charts, truncated axes to exaggerate effects, KPI soup without context.
texts.text: Anti-patterns: dual y-axes misuse, 3D charts, truncated axes to exaggerate effects, KPI soup without context.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Business Problem Framing (hypotheses, constraints, ROI)
texts.text: Business Problem Framing (hypotheses, constraints, ROI)

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Technical excellence only matters if it changes outcomes. Frame problems as decisions under constraints with explicit payoffs and risks.
texts.text: Technical excellence only matters if it changes outcomes. Frame problems as decisions under constraints with explicit payoffs and risks.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Define the decision: action set, frequency, who acts; map to a north-star metric and guardrails.
texts.text: Define the decision: action set, frequency, who acts; map to a north-star metric and guardrails.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Hypotheses: causal story of how your lever moves the metric; measurable assumptions.
texts.text: Hypotheses: causal story of how your lever moves the metric; measurable assumptions.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Constraints: latency, budget, data availability/quality, regulatory/privacy limits, fairness thresholds.
texts.text: Constraints: latency, budget, data availability/quality, regulatory/privacy limits, fairness thresholds.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ROI model: back-of-envelope value, cost to build/maintain, sensitivity to adoption and error rates.
texts.text: ROI model: back-of-envelope value, cost to build/maintain, sensitivity to adoption and error rates.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Data readiness: sources, coverage, leakage risks, label latency, feedback loops.
texts.text: Data readiness: sources, coverage, leakage risks, label latency, feedback loops.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Evaluation plan: offline metrics  business KPI, decision thresholds (ROC  profit curve), A/B or quasiexperimental design.
texts.text: Evaluation plan: offline metrics  business KPI, decision thresholds (ROC  profit curve), A/B or quasiexperimental design.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Risk & fallback: failure modes, rollback, shadow launches, human-in-the-loop.
texts.text: Risk & fallback: failure modes, rollback, shadow launches, human-in-the-loop.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Anti-patterns: starting from an algorithm, optimizing proxy metrics, ignoring operational adoption.
texts.text: Anti-patterns: starting from an algorithm, optimizing proxy metrics, ignoring operational adoption.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Communication & Stakeholder Management
texts.text: Communication & Stakeholder Management

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Influence comes from clarity, cadence, and trust. Tailor depth to the audience and keep a shared source of truth.
texts.text: Influence comes from clarity, cadence, and trust. Tailor depth to the audience and keep a shared source of truth.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Audience mapping: execs (outcomes/risks), PMs (trade-offs/roadmap), Eng (interfaces/SLAs), Ops (playbooks), Legal (compliance).
texts.text: Audience mapping: execs (outcomes/risks), PMs (trade-offs/roadmap), Eng (interfaces/SLAs), Ops (playbooks), Legal (compliance).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Artifacts: 1-pager PRD/DRD, experiment pre-reg, weekly updates, launch checklist, post-mortems; living metric definitions.
texts.text: Artifacts: 1-pager PRD/DRD, experiment pre-reg, weekly updates, launch checklist, post-mortems; living metric definitions.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Cadence: kickoffs, design reviews, decision meetings with options, read-outs with 'recommend / next steps / owner'.
texts.text: Cadence: kickoffs, design reviews, decision meetings with options, read-outs with 'recommend / next steps / owner'.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Expectation setting: scope, assumptions, MDE/power limits, timelines; say 'no' with alternatives.
texts.text: Expectation setting: scope, assumptions, MDE/power limits, timelines; say 'no' with alternatives.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Collaboration: write clear specs (schemas, APIs), agree on data contracts, co-own monitoring.
texts.text: Collaboration: write clear specs (schemas, APIs), agree on data contracts, co-own monitoring.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Conflict handling: surface trade-offs, show scenario tables, log decisions; escalate with crisp evidence.
texts.text: Conflict handling: surface trade-offs, show scenario tables, log decisions; escalate with crisp evidence.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Anti-patterns: over-promising, burying the lede, jargon dumps, undocumented decisions.
texts.text: Anti-patterns: over-promising, burying the lede, jargon dumps, undocumented decisions.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 4) Tools & Tech Stack - Data Scientist
texts.text: 4) Tools & Tech Stack - Data Scientist

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Data Platforms (Snowflake / BigQuery / Redshift; Lakehouse)
texts.text: Data Platforms (Snowflake / BigQuery / Redshift; Lakehouse)

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Modern analytics lives on cloud warehouses and lakehouses. Warehouses (Snowflake, BigQuery, Redshift) prioritize ANSI SQL, elastic compute, and governance; lakehouses (Databricks + Delta, Apache Iceberg/Hudi on S3/GCS/ADLS) unify data lakes with ACID tables and open formats for ML at scale.
texts.text: Modern analytics lives on cloud warehouses and lakehouses. Warehouses (Snowflake, BigQuery, Redshift) prioritize ANSI SQL, elastic compute, and governance; lakehouses (Databricks + Delta, Apache Iceberg/Hudi on S3/GCS/ADLS) unify data lakes with ACID tables and open formats for ML at scale.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: What they're best at
texts.text: What they're best at

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Warehouses: fast SQL, concurrency, fine-grained RBAC, simple ops, reliable BI.
texts.text: o Warehouses: fast SQL, concurrency, fine-grained RBAC, simple ops, reliable BI.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Lakehouse: cheap storage, open formats (Parquet + Delta/Iceberg), ML-friendly files, streaming + batch unification.
texts.text: o Lakehouse: cheap storage, open formats (Parquet + Delta/Iceberg), ML-friendly files, streaming + batch unification.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Selection criteria
texts.text: Selection criteria

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Data size & variety (semi-structured JSON/Avro), latency needs, cost model (on-demand vs slots/warehouses), governance (RBAC, data masking), interoperability with ML tools.
texts.text: o Data size & variety (semi-structured JSON/Avro), latency needs, cost model (on-demand vs slots/warehouses), governance (RBAC, data masking), interoperability with ML tools.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Performance & cost hygiene
texts.text: Performance & cost hygiene

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Column pruning, clustering/partitioning, materialized views, result caching, avoid SELECT * , compressed columnar formats, storage lifecycle policies.
texts.text: o Column pruning, clustering/partitioning, materialized views, result caching, avoid SELECT * , compressed columnar formats, storage lifecycle policies.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Reliability & quality
texts.text: Reliability & quality

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Data contracts , schema evolution, SCD handling, time-travel/versioned tables, CDC ingestion (Debezium/Fivetran).
texts.text: o Data contracts , schema evolution, SCD handling, time-travel/versioned tables, CDC ingestion (Debezium/Fivetran).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Pitfalls
texts.text: Pitfalls

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Mixed grains in KPIs, unbounded costs from ad-hoc scans, unmanaged external tables without ACID.
texts.text: o Mixed grains in KPIs, unbounded costs from ad-hoc scans, unmanaged external tables without ACID.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Orchestration & Transformation (Airflow, dbt)
texts.text: Orchestration & Transformation (Airflow, dbt)

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Orchestration schedules reliable pipelines; transformation frameworks make SQL changes testable and modular.
texts.text: Orchestration schedules reliable pipelines; transformation frameworks make SQL changes testable and modular.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Roles
texts.text: Roles

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Airflow (or Prefect/Dagster): DAG orchestration, retries, SLAs, backfills, dependencies.
texts.text: o Airflow (or Prefect/Dagster): DAG orchestration, retries, SLAs, backfills, dependencies.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o dbt: SQL-first transformations with tests , documentation , macros , and environments .
texts.text: o dbt: SQL-first transformations with tests , documentation , macros , and environments .

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Best practices
texts.text: Best practices

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Separate extract/load from transform ; small idempotent tasks; explicit data dependencies; parameterize by date.
texts.text: o Separate extract/load from transform ; small idempotent tasks; explicit data dependencies; parameterize by date.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o In dbt: source freshness tests, unique/not-null tests, staging  marts layers, CI on pull requests, docs site.
texts.text: o In dbt: source freshness tests, unique/not-null tests, staging  marts layers, CI on pull requests, docs site.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Ops & observability
texts.text: Ops & observability

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Task-level retries, alerting on SLAs/failures, lineage graphs, data quality gates pre-publish.
texts.text: o Task-level retries, alerting on SLAs/failures, lineage graphs, data quality gates pre-publish.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Pitfalls
texts.text: Pitfalls

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Spaghetti DAGs, hidden side effects, long monolithic SQL models, lack of backfills/version pins.
texts.text: o Spaghetti DAGs, hidden side effects, long monolithic SQL models, lack of backfills/version pins.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Notebooks / IDEs (Jupyter, VS Code)
texts.text: Notebooks / IDEs (Jupyter, VS Code)

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Notebooks excel at EDA and narration; IDEs shine for production code, tests, and refactors. Use both deliberately.
texts.text: Notebooks excel at EDA and narration; IDEs shine for production code, tests, and refactors. Use both deliberately.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Working pattern
texts.text: Working pattern

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Start in Jupyter/JupyterLab for exploration; migrate stable code into VS Code modules with tests.
texts.text: o Start in Jupyter/JupyterLab for exploration; migrate stable code into VS Code modules with tests.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Reproducibility
texts.text: Reproducibility

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Pin environments, nbstripout outputs, parameterize with papermill/jupytext , set random seeds, cache dataset snapshots.
texts.text: o Pin environments, nbstripout outputs, parameterize with papermill/jupytext , set random seeds, cache dataset snapshots.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Productivity
texts.text: Productivity

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o VS Code: remote dev containers, debugger, notebooks editor, type checking, test runner; Jupyter: rich widgets/plots.
texts.text: o VS Code: remote dev containers, debugger, notebooks editor, type checking, test runner; Jupyter: rich widgets/plots.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Pitfalls
texts.text: Pitfalls

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Hidden state, out-of-order execution, large data in cells, notebooks as the only artifact.
texts.text: o Hidden state, out-of-order execution, large data in cells, notebooks as the only artifact.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: ML Libraries (scikit-learn, XGBoost/LightGBM, PyTorch/TensorFlow)
texts.text: ML Libraries (scikit-learn, XGBoost/LightGBM, PyTorch/TensorFlow)

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Pick the simplest library that meets accuracy/latency needs; prefer tabular SOTA (boosting) before deep nets unless representation learning is required.
texts.text: Pick the simplest library that meets accuracy/latency needs; prefer tabular SOTA (boosting) before deep nets unless representation learning is required.

texts.text: Tabular & classical

texts.label: list_item

texts.text: o scikit-learn: pipelines, metrics, model selection; baselines (logreg, RF).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o XGBoost/LightGBM/CatBoost: strong tabular performance; handle nonlinearity & interactions.
texts.text: o XGBoost/LightGBM/CatBoost: strong tabular performance; handle nonlinearity & interactions.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Deep learning
texts.text: Deep learning

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o PyTorch/TensorFlow/Keras: images/text/sequence models, custom architectures, GPU acceleration.
texts.text: o PyTorch/TensorFlow/Keras: images/text/sequence models, custom architectures, GPU acceleration.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Ecosystem: Hugging Face (transformers/datasets/eval), timm, torchvision.
texts.text: o Ecosystem: Hugging Face (transformers/datasets/eval), timm, torchvision.

texts.text: Training & tuning

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Cross-validation, early stopping, class weights, Optuna/Bayes optimization, calibration (Platt/isotonic).
texts.text: o Cross-validation, early stopping, class weights, Optuna/Bayes optimization, calibration (Platt/isotonic).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Serving
texts.text: Serving

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Batch scoring vs real-time (ONNX/TensorRT), quantization/pruning, AOT compilers (TorchScript, XLA).
texts.text: o Batch scoring vs real-time (ONNX/TensorRT), quantization/pruning, AOT compilers (TorchScript, XLA).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Pitfalls
texts.text: Pitfalls

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Leakage in feature engineering, chasing deep models on small tabular data, ignoring calibration/uncertainty.
texts.text: o Leakage in feature engineering, chasing deep models on small tabular data, ignoring calibration/uncertainty.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: BI & Experiment Tools (Tableau / Power BI; experiment platforms)
texts.text: BI & Experiment Tools (Tableau / Power BI; experiment platforms)

texts.label: text
texts.orig: BI surfaces 'what is happening'; experiment platforms validate 'what works.' Both need trustworthy metrics and governance.
texts.text: BI surfaces 'what is happening'; experiment platforms validate 'what works.' Both need trustworthy metrics and governance.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: BI stacks
texts.text: BI stacks

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Tableau/Power BI/Looker/Superset for dashboards, semantic layers, row-level security, scheduled extracts.
texts.text: o Tableau/Power BI/Looker/Superset for dashboards, semantic layers, row-level security, scheduled extracts.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Practices: certified dashboards, single source of truth for metric definitions, usage monitoring.
texts.text: o Practices: certified dashboards, single source of truth for metric definitions, usage monitoring.

texts.text: Experimentation

texts.text: o Optimizely/Statsig/LaunchDarkly/GrowthBook or in-house: randomization, CUPED, sequential tests, guardrails.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Checks: power/MDE, sample ratio mismatch (SRM), interference/spillover, pre-registration of hypotheses.
texts.text: o Checks: power/MDE, sample ratio mismatch (SRM), interference/spillover, pre-registration of hypotheses.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Communication
texts.text: Communication

texts.label: list_item

texts.text: o Scorecards: treatment effects, CIs, cohort cuts, decision recommendations, rollback criteria.

texts.text: Pitfalls

texts.label: list_item

texts.text: o Metric shopping, unmanaged KPI proliferation, running too many concurrent tests on same population.

texts.text: Cloud & Infra (AWS / GCP / Azure; containers)

texts.text: Cloud gives elastic compute/storage; containers/Kubernetes provide portability and repeatable deployment.

texts.text: o Compute: EC2/GCE/VMSS, serverless (Lambda/Cloud Functions), batch; GPU (A100/H100) for DL.

texts.label: list_item

texts.text: o Storage: S3/GCS/ADLS (data lake), EBS/PD (block), EFS/Filestore (shared).

texts.text: o Networking & security: VPCs, private subnets, security groups, IAM least privilege, KMS/CMK.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Containers: Docker + Kubernetes (EKS/GKE/AKS) for scaling model APIs and jobs.
texts.text: o Containers: Docker + Kubernetes (EKS/GKE/AKS) for scaling model APIs and jobs.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Ops & cost
texts.text: Ops & cost

texts.orig: o Autoscaling, spot/preemptible for training, node pools by workload, cost tags/budgets, artifact registries.
texts.text: o Autoscaling, spot/preemptible for training, node pools by workload, cost tags/budgets, artifact registries.

texts.label: list_item

texts.text: MLOps services

texts.label: list_item

texts.text: o Managed notebooks, model endpoints (SageMaker/Vertex/AML), pipelines, feature stores, monitoring.

texts.text: Tracking & Registry (MLflow; model/feature stores)

texts.text: Without tracking, you can't reproduce or govern models. Use experiment tracking + registries + feature stores for consistency.

texts.label: list_item

texts.text: o MLflow/W&B/Vertex Experiments: log params, metrics, artifacts, datasets, code versions; compare runs.

texts.text: Version Control & Environments (Git, venv/conda)

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 5) Responsibilities & Deliverables - Data Scientist
texts.text: 5) Responsibilities & Deliverables - Data Scientist

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: EDA & Data Quality reports
texts.text: EDA & Data Quality reports

texts.label: text
texts.orig: A good EDA clarifies what the data can and cannot support before modeling. It surfaces leakage, label latency, missingness patterns, and cohort biases; it also states whether the dataset is decision-grade.
texts.text: A good EDA clarifies what the data can and cannot support before modeling. It surfaces leakage, label latency, missingness patterns, and cohort biases; it also states whether the dataset is decision-grade.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: What to include
texts.text: What to include

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Context: purpose, target decision/KPI, unit of analysis, time window.
texts.text: o Context: purpose, target decision/KPI, unit of analysis, time window.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Schema profile: fields, types, cardinality, allowed ranges, PII flags.
texts.text: o Schema profile: fields, types, cardinality, allowed ranges, PII flags.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Target audit: base rates, drift over time, label latency, leakage risks.
texts.text: o Target audit: base rates, drift over time, label latency, leakage risks.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Missingness & anomalies: MCAR/MAR/MNAR hypotheses, outliers, duplicates.
texts.text: o Missingness & anomalies: MCAR/MAR/MNAR hypotheses, outliers, duplicates.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Cohorts & bias: performance-critical slices (geo, product line, device), prevalence by slice.
texts.text: o Cohorts & bias: performance-critical slices (geo, product line, device), prevalence by slice.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Data lineage & freshness: source systems, ingestion lag, backfills, known quirks.
texts.text: o Data lineage & freshness: source systems, ingestion lag, backfills, known quirks.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Decision note: 'Fit for purpose' verdict + gaps and mitigation plan.
texts.text: o Decision note: 'Fit for purpose' verdict + gaps and mitigation plan.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Acceptance criteria
texts.text: Acceptance criteria

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Reproducible notebook/script; summary one-pager with charts and a go/no-go statement.
texts.text: o Reproducible notebook/script; summary one-pager with charts and a go/no-go statement.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Common pitfalls
texts.text: Common pitfalls

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Mixed grains, silent de-duplication, using post-outcome fields (leakage), ignoring seasonality.
texts.text: o Mixed grains, silent de-duplication, using post-outcome fields (leakage), ignoring seasonality.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Feature engineering & dataset contracts
texts.text: Feature engineering & dataset contracts

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Feature work turns raw tables into stable, error-tolerant signals. A dataset/feature contract encodes definitions so upstream changes don't silently break models.
texts.text: Feature work turns raw tables into stable, error-tolerant signals. A dataset/feature contract encodes definitions so upstream changes don't silently break models.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: What to include
texts.text: What to include

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Feature spec: name, business meaning, SQL/py pseudocode, allowed nulls, range, timezone, unit.
texts.text: o Feature spec: name, business meaning, SQL/py pseudocode, allowed nulls, range, timezone, unit.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Point-in-time correctness: time joins, label windows, leakage checks.
texts.text: o Point-in-time correctness: time joins, label windows, leakage checks.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Training/serving parity: same logic (dbt/Feast/feature store), backfill strategy.
texts.text: o Training/serving parity: same logic (dbt/Feast/feature store), backfill strategy.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Quality tests: uniqueness, referential integrity, freshness SLAs, anomaly thresholds.
texts.text: o Quality tests: uniqueness, referential integrity, freshness SLAs, anomaly thresholds.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Versioning: semantic version + change log, deprecation policy.
texts.text: o Versioning: semantic version + change log, deprecation policy.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Deliverables
texts.text: Deliverables

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o dbt models (or feature store defs), validation tests, and a rendered contract page.
texts.text: o dbt models (or feature store defs), validation tests, and a rendered contract page.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Common pitfalls
texts.text: Common pitfalls

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Target/mean encoding without leakage guards; recomputing features differently online vs offline.
texts.text: o Target/mean encoding without leakage guards; recomputing features differently online vs offline.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: A solid data-science hire blends statistical rigor, product sense, and production-minded coding. 'Minimum' ensures they can contribute safely; 'preferred' signals they can lead end-to-end impact.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Level expectations (Junior  Senior  Staff/Principal)
texts.text: Level expectations (Junior  Senior  Staff/Principal)

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Progression reflects increasing independence, scope, and risk ownership . Titles vary, but the capability curve is consistent: from executing clearly scoped tasks to setting technical direction and de-risking ambiguous problems for others .
texts.text: Progression reflects increasing independence, scope, and risk ownership . Titles vary, but the capability curve is consistent: from executing clearly scoped tasks to setting technical direction and de-risking ambiguous problems for others .

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Junior / Associate (entry-~2 years)
texts.text: Junior / Associate (entry-~2 years)

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Executes well-defined tasks: clean datasets, build baselines, run evaluations.
texts.text: o Executes well-defined tasks: clean datasets, build baselines, run evaluations.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Needs guidance to frame problems and avoid pitfalls (leakage, invalid CV).
texts.text: o Needs guidance to frame problems and avoid pitfalls (leakage, invalid CV).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Learning focus: strong SQL/EDA, validation patterns, writing crisp analysis notes.
texts.text: o Learning focus: strong SQL/EDA, validation patterns, writing crisp analysis notes.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Mid-Level (solid individual contributor)
texts.text: Mid-Level (solid individual contributor)

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Owns a feature/model end-to-end under a PM/tech lead's umbrella.
texts.text: o Owns a feature/model end-to-end under a PM/tech lead's umbrella.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Anticipates edge cases, writes reproducible code, proposes reasonable baselines & metrics.
texts.text: o Anticipates edge cases, writes reproducible code, proposes reasonable baselines & metrics.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Collaborates smoothly with Eng/PM; can run a small A/B.
texts.text: o Collaborates smoothly with Eng/PM; can run a small A/B.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Senior
texts.text: Senior

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Frames problems with stakeholders; chooses approach, metrics, experiment design.
texts.text: o Frames problems with stakeholders; chooses approach, metrics, experiment design.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Multimodel comparisons, calibration, monitoring plans; mentors juniors.
texts.text: o Multimodel comparisons, calibration, monitoring plans; mentors juniors.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Predictably ships business impact; drafts decision docs and rollout/rollback plans.
texts.text: o Predictably ships business impact; drafts decision docs and rollout/rollback plans.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Staff (org-level problem solver)
texts.text: Staff (org-level problem solver)

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Tackles high-ambiguity problems across teams; creates standards (e.g., feature contracts, KPI catalogs).
texts.text: o Tackles high-ambiguity problems across teams; creates standards (e.g., feature contracts, KPI catalogs).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o De-risks complex launches; drives technical roadmaps; influences headcount and platform direction.
texts.text: o De-risks complex launches; drives technical roadmaps; influences headcount and platform direction.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Mentors seniors; coordinates multi-team initiatives.
texts.text: o Mentors seniors; coordinates multi-team initiatives.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Principal / Distinguished
texts.text: Principal / Distinguished

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Sets long-horizon strategy (6-24 months): methodology, platforms, cross-org investments.
texts.text: o Sets long-horizon strategy (6-24 months): methodology, platforms, cross-org investments.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Creates widely adopted patterns; represents the company externally; shapes hiring bar.
texts.text: o Creates widely adopted patterns; represents the company externally; shapes hiring bar.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Solves 'no known playbook' problems, often with applied research depth.
texts.text: o Solves 'no known playbook' problems, often with applied research depth.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Scope & autonomy by level (project  product area  org)
texts.text: Scope & autonomy by level (project  product area  org)

texts.label: text
texts.orig: As you rise, scope widens from a project to a portfolio/product area to organizational concerns; autonomy tracks your ability to manage risk and trade-offs.
texts.text: As you rise, scope widens from a project to a portfolio/product area to organizational concerns; autonomy tracks your ability to manage risk and trade-offs.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Project scope (Junior/Mid): a single model or dashboard with clear acceptance criteria; relies on lead for framing.
texts.text: Project scope (Junior/Mid): a single model or dashboard with clear acceptance criteria; relies on lead for framing.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Product-area scope (Senior): multiple related models/metrics; balances impact vs complexity; defines success metrics & guardrails.
texts.text: Product-area scope (Senior): multiple related models/metrics; balances impact vs complexity; defines success metrics & guardrails.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Org scope (Staff+): platforms, standards, or multi-team efforts; resolves cross-team dependencies; sets roadmaps.
texts.text: Org scope (Staff+): platforms, standards, or multi-team efforts; resolves cross-team dependencies; sets roadmaps.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Autonomy signals: reduces manager load; proactively raises risks; quantifies trade-offs; aligns peers without escalation.
texts.text: Autonomy signals: reduces manager load; proactively raises risks; quantifies trade-offs; aligns peers without escalation.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: IC vs Manager tracks (people leadership vs deep IC)
texts.text: IC vs Manager tracks (people leadership vs deep IC)

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Two equally senior ladders. ICs lead via technical direction and execution ; managers lead through people, outcomes, and process .
texts.text: Two equally senior ladders. ICs lead via technical direction and execution ; managers lead through people, outcomes, and process .

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: IC (Senior/Staff/Principal)
texts.text: IC (Senior/Staff/Principal)

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Deep technical ownership, design reviews, de-risking plans, cross-team technical influence.
texts.text: o Deep technical ownership, design reviews, de-risking plans, cross-team technical influence.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Mentors and unblocks others; no formal performance management.
texts.text: o Mentors and unblocks others; no formal performance management.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Ideal if you enjoy building, teaching through code/docs, and setting technical standards.
texts.text: o Ideal if you enjoy building, teaching through code/docs, and setting technical standards.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Manager (DS Manager  Sr. Manager  Director/Head)
texts.text: Manager (DS Manager  Sr. Manager  Director/Head)

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Owns hiring, growth, performance, prioritization, stakeholder alignment, and delivery.
texts.text: o Owns hiring, growth, performance, prioritization, stakeholder alignment, and delivery.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Builds teams & processes (on-call, QA, experiment review), manages budgets.
texts.text: o Builds teams & processes (on-call, QA, experiment review), manages budgets.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Ideal if you like coaching, portfolio management, and cross-functional negotiation.
texts.text: o Ideal if you like coaching, portfolio management, and cross-functional negotiation.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Switching considerations
texts.text: Switching considerations

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o IC  Mgr: proven mentorship, reliable project delivery, appetite for hiring/perf.
texts.text: o IC  Mgr: proven mentorship, reliable project delivery, appetite for hiring/perf.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Mgr  IC: desire for depth, complex design work, less interest in performance cycles.
texts.text: o Mgr  IC: desire for depth, complex design work, less interest in performance cycles.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Comp components (base, bonus, equity) & drivers (region, stage, sector)
texts.text: Comp components (base, bonus, equity) & drivers (region, stage, sector)

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Comp is a bundle: base salary (cash), bonus (performance), equity (ownership), sometimes sign-on and benefits . Market levels move with macro cycles.
texts.text: Comp is a bundle: base salary (cash), bonus (performance), equity (ownership), sometimes sign-on and benefits . Market levels move with macro cycles.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Components
texts.text: Components

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Base: predictable monthly cash; banded by level/location.
texts.text: o Base: predictable monthly cash; banded by level/location.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Bonus: % of base; tied to company + individual performance.
texts.text: o Bonus: % of base; tied to company + individual performance.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Equity: options (strike price, 4-yr vest, 1-yr cliff) or RSUs (vest on schedule/liquidity).
texts.text: o Equity: options (strike price, 4-yr vest, 1-yr cliff) or RSUs (vest on schedule/liquidity).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Extras: sign-on, relocation, education, WFH stipend, on-call pay (less common for DS).
texts.text: o Extras: sign-on, relocation, education, WFH stipend, on-call pay (less common for DS).

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Key drivers
texts.text: Key drivers

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Region: US/EU metros pay > emerging markets; fully-remote often aligns to geo bands.
texts.text: o Region: US/EU metros pay > emerging markets; fully-remote often aligns to geo bands.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Company stage: late-stage/FAANG-ish = higher cash + RSUs; early-stage = lower cash + higher options (higher variance).
texts.text: o Company stage: late-stage/FAANG-ish = higher cash + RSUs; early-stage = lower cash + higher options (higher variance).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Sector: finance/quant, ads, and AI platform infra pay premiums; non-profit/public sector lower but stable.
texts.text: o Sector: finance/quant, ads, and AI platform infra pay premiums; non-profit/public sector lower but stable.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Skill scarcity: recsys, causal inference at scale, LLM safety/eval, or strong MLOps can command premiums.
texts.text: o Skill scarcity: recsys, causal inference at scale, LLM safety/eval, or strong MLOps can command premiums.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Equity nuances
texts.text: Equity nuances

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Options need an exit to realize value; RSUs are more liquid at public companies.
texts.text: o Options need an exit to realize value; RSUs are more liquid at public companies.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Refreshers typically start at Senior+; ask about refresher cadence and promotion equity.
texts.text: o Refreshers typically start at Senior+; ask about refresher cadence and promotion equity.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: (Avoid quoting hard numbers in docs you'll reuse; bands fluctuate by quarter and geography.)
texts.text: (Avoid quoting hard numbers in docs you'll reuse; bands fluctuate by quarter and geography.)
